intro: Lappula echinophora var. pachypoda, commonly known as the thickstem lappula, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its fruit is a dry, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. This variety is distinguished by its thick, fleshy stems, which contribute to its common name.
